case_title: KHUDA BAKHSH vs Syed MUHAMMAD HABIB SHAH HASHMI
case_number: Civil Petition for Special Leave to Appeal No. 223-R of 1977
legal_basis: West Pakistan Urban Rent Restriction Ordinance VI of 1959
key_issues: Requirement of house for respondent's own use and children

rent_controller.finding: Respondent proved requirement in good faith; subletting not proved
rent_controller.order: Eviction of petitioner with two months to vacate

district_court.finding: Respondent proved requirement; petitioner sublet premises

arguments_by_petitioner.claim: Eviction application not bona fide due to rent enhancement
arguments_by_petitioner.court_response: Rejected by all courts as rent increase was based on property valuation by municipality

arguments_by_petitioner.claim: Respondent owned another house sufficient for his family
arguments_by_petitioner.court_response: Rejected as respondent's family size required additional space

arguments_by_petitioner.claim: Respondent's indecision on who would occupy the house
arguments_by_petitioner.court_response: Rejected as immaterial under subsection (3) of section 13 of the Ordinance

final_order.condition: Petitioner must continue paying monthly rent
